com.ibm.ecm.api.coresdk.model

Interface IBMECMApplication


  • public interface IBMECMApplication
    Represents the main application or device interfacing with this SDK.

    An application object is the top-level object of this SDK. It holds all the IBMECMDesktop objects that this application will be accessing. A default desktop is usually set in the IBM Content Navigator server and is provided to this SDK by the baseURL set in IBMECMFactory.getApplication(String, boolean). You can also provide or switch to a different desktop by providing a desktopId param in the baseURL.

    Typically you will want to call loadCurrentDesktop(IBMECMCompletionHandler) to load each desktop information. By loading the desktop, you will bring down all the settings, information, and repositories this application can access. You can also call login(String, String, IBMECMCompletionHandler) to authenticate to the default repository for the default desktop.

    There should only be one application instance that represents your application. You can obtain this singleton instance from IBMECMFactory.getApplication(String, boolean)

    • Method Detail

      • getDesktopURL

        String getDesktopURL()
        Returns current desktop URL. This is the URL that points to the IBM Content Navigator server.
        Returns:
        the current desktop URL

      • getAppKey

        String getAppKey()
        Returns the unique key identifying the application.
        Returns:
        the unique key identifying the application

      • getServerContextRootURL

        String getServerContextRootURL()
        Returns the current server's context root URL.
        Returns:
        the current server's context root URL

      • getDesktopName

        String getDesktopName()
        Returns the current desktop's name. This will be null until loadCurrentDesktop(IBMECMCompletionHandler) is called.
        Returns:
        the current desktop's name

      • getCurrentDesktop

        IBMECMDesktop getCurrentDesktop()
        Returns a reference to the current desktop that this application will access. If a specific desktop was provided in the application's baseURL, this is the desktop that will be returned. If not, the default desktop set in IBM Content Navigator is returned.

        This will be null until loadCurrentDesktop(IBMECMCompletionHandler) is called.

        Returns:
        a reference to IBMECMDesktop object

      • isPasswordPersistAllowed

        boolean isPasswordPersistAllowed()
        Returns whether password persistence is allowed.
        Returns:
        true if password persistence is allowed

      • getAuthenticatorDataSource

        IBMECMAuthenticatorDataSource getAuthenticatorDataSource()
        Returns the IBMECMAuthenticatorDataSource object set in this application. An authenticator datasource is used to provide custom authentication for this application.
        Returns:
        the authenticator data

      • setAuthenticatorDataSource

        void setAuthenticatorDataSource(IBMECMAuthenticatorDataSource authenticatorDataSource)
        Sets the IBMECMAuthenticatorDataSource object for this application. If set, this authenticator datasouce will be used to provide custom authentication.
        Parameters:
        authenticatorDataSource - the authenticator data source that enables custom authentication to be injected

      • setIsPasswordPersistAllowed

        void setIsPasswordPersistAllowed(boolean passwordPersistAllowed)
        Sets whether to allow password persistence. If set to true, this application will persist an encrypted password as part of the login. Persisting the password provides a way to log in without asking for credentials every time.
        Parameters:
        passwordPersistAllowed - true to allow this application to persist the password

      • loadDesktop

        void loadDesktop(String desktopId,
                 IBMECMCompletionHandler<IBMECMDesktop> onComplete)
        Loads the desktop using the provided desktop id. A desktop provides a number of configuration and repositories that this application will be accessing.

        You must load the desktop before it can be used.

        Parameters:
        desktopId - the id of the desktop to load
        onComplete - the completion callback that returns a loaded desktop object

      • loadCurrentDesktop

        void loadCurrentDesktop(IBMECMCompletionHandler<IBMECMDesktop> onComplete)
        Loads the current desktop for this application. A desktop provides a number of configuration and repositories that this application will be accessing.

        You must load the desktop before it can be used.

        Parameters:
        onComplete - the completion callback that returns a loaded desktop object

      • login

        void login(String username,
           String password,
           IBMECMCompletionHandler<Boolean> onComplete)
        Logs in to this application. The login performs the appropriate container login or repository login as specified by the desktop and repository settings in IBM Content Navigator.

        This will log into the default repository in the default desktop.

        Parameters:
        username - the user name to log in as
        password - the user's password
        onComplete - the completion callback that returns true if the the user is logged in

      • logoff

        void logoff(IBMECMCompletionHandler<Boolean> onComplete)
        Logs the current user off from the current application.
        Parameters:
        onComplete - the completion callback that returns true if the user is logged out

      • getCookieManager

        CookieManager getCookieManager()
        Returns the CookieManager set for this application. The cookies set for this application will typically match the cookies in the default repository in the default desktop.
        Returns:
        the CookieManager set for this application

      • getAcceptSelfSignedCertificates

        boolean getAcceptSelfSignedCertificates()
        Returns whether self signed certificates are allowed.
        Returns:
        true if self signed certificates are allowed (not secure)
